Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We are given an event log for a Procure to Pay P2P process The typical steps in a standard P2P process are 1 Create Purchase Requisition PR 2 Approve Purchase Requisition 3 Issue Purchase Order PO 4 Receive Goods or services 5 Vendor Invoice Received 6 Match Invoice to PO and possibly to receiving documents 7 Release Payment 8 Close Case or similar final step Sometimes the order might vary slightly but generally the flow is PR creation PR approval PO issuance Goods receipt Invoice receipt Invoice matching Payment release Case closure

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We are to identify anomalies in the given event log Lets examine each case Case 1001 Create PR 2024 02 01 08 00 Approve PR 2024 02 01 08 15 Issue PO 2024 02 01 09 00 Receive Goods 2024 02 02 10 00 Vendor Invoice Received 2024 02 02 11 30 Match Invoice to PO 2024 02 05 09 00 Release Payment 2024 02 06 10 00 Close Case 2024 02 07 15 00 This seems normal

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1002 Create PR 2024 02 01 08 30 Issue PO 2024 02 01 08 40 Here the PO is issued before approval of PR Actually the order after Create PR the next is Approve PR but we see Issue PO before Approve PR This is an anomaly PO issued before PR approval Vendor Invoice Received 2024 02 03 07 00 Release Payment 2024 02 03 07 15 Payment released before goods receipt And before invoice matching Also payment released before approval of PR Many issues Approve PR 2024 02 03 08 00 Approval after payment This is out of order Receive Goods 2024 02 04 09 00 Goods received after payment Thats unusual Match Invoice to PO 2024 02 05 08 00 Matching after payment Thats also unusual Close Case 2024 02 06 16 00 So many anomalies PO before PR approval payment before goods receipt payment before invoice matching etc

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1003 Create PR 2024 02 02 09 00 Approve PR 2024 02 02 09 10 Issue PO 2024 02 02 10 00 Release Payment 2024 02 08 11 00 Payment released before goods receipt and invoice received Actually invoice received on 2024 02 09 goods received on 2024 02 10 so payment is before goods and invoice Thats anomalous Vendor Invoice Received 2024 02 09 12 00 Receive Goods 2024 02 10 13 00 Match Invoice to PO 2024 02 11 14 00 Close Case 2024 02 12 10 00 So payment released before goods receipt and before invoice receipt Thats problematic

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1004 Create PR 2024 02 05 10 00 Approve PR 2024 02 05 10 15 Receive Goods 2024 02 06 09 00 Goods received before PO issuance Thats unusual Issue PO 2024 02 06 09 15 PO issued after goods receipt Actually PO issued at 09 15 goods received at 09 00 so goods received first Thats anomalous Vendor Invoice Received 2024 02 07 08 00 Match Invoice to PO 2024 02 07 08 30 Release Payment 2024 02 07 09 00 Close Case 2024 02 08 11 00 So goods received before PO is issued Thats not standard

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We have identified anomalies in cases 1002 1003 and 1004 Case 1001 seems normal Now we need to explain why these anomalies might be problematic Well discuss each case But note The question says identify any sequences of activities that seem unusual or anomalous and explain why they might be problematic So we should list the anomalies and explain Lets summarize Case 1002 PO issued before PR approval Payment released before goods receipt and before invoice matching PR approval after payment Goods received after payment Invoice matching after payment Case 1003 Payment released before goods receipt and before invoice receipt Invoice received after payment Goods received after payment Case 1004 Goods received before PO issuance PO issued after goods receipt We should also note if there are any other minor issues but these are the main ones Now write the answer
